{"step_by_step_thinking": "Early fusion of the coronal suture results in brachycephaly. Brachycephaly is a condition characterized by a wide and high head shape. The coronal suture runs over the top of the head, and when it fuses prematurely, it restricts the growth of the skull in the anteroposterior direction, resulting in a wide and short head shape.", "answer_choice": "A"}
